article_title: Jeb Bush's strategy to win Ohio emerges as Koch brothers summit begins
article_text:
Total Access

Enjoy the convenience of home delivery plus Digital D. Sign up for our BEST VALUE today!

article_metadata.description: Jeb Bush not only nabbed a key speaking slot Friday denied to John Kasich, but his super-PAC is laying the groundwork to beat the Ohio governor on his own turf in next year’s presidential primary election. Right to Rise USA plans to spend up to $1 million before the year is up targeting 400,000 Ohio Republicans their polling already has identified as receptive to the former Florida governor’s message. The super-PAC will have a team scouting the state next week in preparation for a lean but full-time operation by October, well in advance of the March 15 primary – which is winner take all.
